asset.name: TransCon_aVEGF_EYC-0305
asset.one_liner: Preclinical TransCon anti-VEGF prodrug (EYC-0305) developed with Eyconis for extended-duration treatment of wet AMD, DME, and other retinal vascular diseases

biology.simple_explanation: VEGF is a signaling protein that promotes blood vessel growth (angiogenesis). In retinal diseases like wet age-related macular degeneration and diabetic macular edema, excessive VEGF drives abnormal blood vessel formation and leakage in the eye, causing vision loss. Anti-VEGF therapies block this signaling. The TransCon approach aims to extend the duration of anti-VEGF activity in the eye, reducing the frequency of intravitreal injections.
